description: Focused on understanding complex software systems, project planning, and the role of information systems in organizations. Emphasis on systems analysis, software architecture, and data-driven decision-making.
achievements: Gained a deep understanding of software development life cycle and system modeling
Learned to analyze business requirements and design appropriate system solutions
Worked in academic teams applying project management techniques to deliver group assignments
Presented case studies connecting technical solutions with organizational goals
Strengthened skills in academic writing, research, and structured problem solving

degree: Associate Degree in Programming and Systems Analysis
description: Built foundational knowledge in programming, data structures, logic, and systems analysis. Focused on understanding how to translate real-world problems into efficient software solutions.
achievements: Acquired strong problem-solving and algorithmic thinking through theoretical and practical coursework
Learned to model systems and write technical documentation for analysis projects
Improved ability to work collaboratively through academic group activities
Completed academic projects involving requirements gathering, modeling, and presentations
Developed time management and self-learning strategies through a demanding academic schedule
